text: Alternatively, since f(A) = 3 + cos²A, and cos²A can be written as (1 + cos 2A)/2, so f(A) = 3 + (1 + cos 2A)/2 = 3 + 1/2 + (cos 2A)/2 = 7/2 + (cos 2A)/2. Therefore, since cos 2A ranges between -1 and 1, then (cos 2A)/2 ranges between -1/2 and 1/2. Therefore, adding 7/2, f(A) ranges between 7/2 - 1/2 = 3 and 7/2 + 1/2 = 4. But since A ≠ nπ/2, 2A ≠ nπ. Therefore, cos 2A ≠ cos(nπ) = (-1)^n. Therefore, cos 2A cannot be equal to 1 or -1. Therefore, (cos 2A)/2 cannot be equal to 1/2 or -1/2.
